intro: Lomatogonium minus, commonly known as the small lomatogonium, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, showcasing adaptations to drought conditions. Its leaves are usually narrow and hairy, which helps reduce water loss. The small, yellow flowers appear in clusters and bloom during the summer months.
